alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coke; Coleman; Runnels; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 15 at 4:32AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Brown, Coke, Coleman, Runnels and Tom Green. * WHEN...Until 630 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from the Concho Valley eastward to Coleman county...moving east into Brown County. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Brownwood, Coleman, Ballinger, Early, Winters, Santa Anna, Robert Lee, Maverick, Bangs, Bronte, Miles, Blanket, Novice, Benoit, Hatchel, Talpa, Crews, Rowena and Glen Cove. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Willis at Belmeade, Cordell at Anderson, Howard and Webster, 4th Street at Wood, Magnolia at Belmeade, Belle Plain at Romines, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, College Hills and Millbrook, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant and Good Shephard at 11th. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Coke; Coleman; Runnels; Tom Green
